curam.util.type
Class Date

java.lang.Object
  curam.util.type.Date
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<Date>
public final class Date
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<Date>

`Curam's` fundamental Date data-type. Date represents a fixed calendar date which is independent of timezone. Unlike DateTime, a Date will appear the same for all users, regardless of the timezone they inhabit. When a Date is converted to a DateTime, the resulting DateTime is set to midnight on that Date in the default timezone.

See Also:
DateTime, Serialized Form

Constructor Detail

Date

public Date()
No-argument constructor sets the date to the zero date of 01-Jan-0001.

Date

public Date(long time)
Construct a Date from a millisecond time value. The date is set to that represented by the specified millisecond time value in the default timezone.

Parameters:
time - millisecond time value

Date

public Date(DateTime dateTime)
Construct a Date from a DateTime. The Date is set equal to the calendar date represented by the DateTime in the default timezone.

Parameters:
dateTime - The date/time to which this date should be set.

Date

public Date(java.util.Calendar calendar)
Construct a date from a calendar. The Date is set equal to the calendar date represented by the Calendar object in the default timezone. This is the equivalent of calling Date(cal.getTime())

Parameters:
calendar - The calendar containing the required date.

getTimeZoneAdjustedDateTime

public DateTime getTimeZoneAdjustedDateTime(java.util.TimeZone timeZone)
Converts a date into a date time. The date time returned is time zone unaware and is stored as the number of milliseconds since January 1, 1970, 00:00:00 GMT.

Parameters:
timeZone - The time zone to be used when converting this date.
Returns:
A date time representing this date as the number of milliseconds since January 1, 1970, 00:00:00 GMT.

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
Convert this date to a string using the format defined by the properties curam.environment.default.dateformat and curam.environment.default.dateseparator. These properties should be specified in the Bootstrap.properties file. If these properties are not specified, the date is returned as a string with the default yyyy-MM-dd format.

Overrides:
toString in class java.lang.Object
Returns:
The date as a formatted string.

toString

public java.lang.String toString(java.lang.String locale)
Convert this date to a string using the format defined by the properties curam.environment.default.dateformat and curam.environment.default.dateseparator. These properties should be specified in the Bootstrap.properties file. If these properties are not specified, the date is returned as a string with the default yyyy-MM-dd format. The locale used for formatting will be based on the locale passed in.

Parameters:
locale - The Locale used to format the Date.
Returns:
The date as a formatted string.

getDate

public static Date getDate(java.lang.String isoDate)
                    throws DateConversionException
Factory method that returns a new Date object.

Parameters:
isoDate - ISO formatted date. This string must be in the format:
  • HHMMSS
  • YYYYMMDDTHHMMSS
  • YYYMMDDTHHMMSS
  • YYYYMMDD
  • YYYMMDD
For the first of these the new Date will have a date element representing the current date.
Returns:
new Date object
Throws:
DateConversionException - The string does not match any of the expected formats, or the fields are invalid (e.g 31st of September).

getFromJavaUtilDate

public static Date getFromJavaUtilDate(java.util.Date javaUtilDate)
Construct a Date from a Date. The Date is set to that represented by the specified instance of Date in the default timezone.

Parameters:
javaUtilDate - The Date to be converted to a Date
Returns:
the newly created Date object .

fromISO8601

public static Date fromISO8601(java.lang.String isoString)
                        throws DateConversionException
Get a Date from an ISO 8601 string in the format yyyymmdd. The string must be exactly 8 characters long. the subfields are parsed as integers and then formatted as a date using java.util.GregorianCalendar. This means that field wrapping can occur according to the rules used by GregorianCalendar, for instance a day value of 33 for January would be interpreted as the second of February.

Parameters:
isoString - the ISO 8601 format string.
Returns:
a new Date object
Throws:
DateConversionException - If the string is null, is not the correct length or does not match the expected format.

undoOverrideDate

public static void undoOverrideDate()
Undo the overriding of the date and allow the system date to be used again.

getCurrentDate

public static Date getCurrentDate()
Get the current Date which can be one of the following, in the following order of precedence:
  • The Business Date for the current transaction, if one has been specified.
  • The overridden date specified by application property curam.test.override.date
    • , if set.
  • The current system date.

    • Returns:
    the current or overridden date.

    overrideCurrentDate

    public static void overrideCurrentDate(Date date)
    Override current date.

    Parameters:
    date - to be returned by getCurrentDate().

    overrideDate

    public static void overrideDate(java.lang.String overrideDateStr)
                         throws java.lang.RuntimeException
    Entry point for overriding a Date.

    Parameters:
    overrideDateStr - The overridden Date in the YYYYMMDD format to specify the Date.
    Throws:
    java.lang.RuntimeException - if an NumberFormatException occurs while parsing the overrideDateStr

    getTimeZoneAdjustedDateTime

    public static DateTime getTimeZoneAdjustedDateTime(Date date,
                                                   java.util.TimeZone timeZone)
    Converts a date into a date time. The date time returned is time zone unaware and is stored as the number of milliseconds since January 1, 1970, 00:00:00 GMT.

    Parameters:
    date - The date to be converted to a date time.
    timeZone - The time zone of the date to be converted.
    Returns:
    The date time representing the specified date as the number of milliseconds since January 1, 1970, 00:00:00 GMT.

    resetCacheForTimezone

    public static void resetCacheForTimezone()
    This method is for testing purposes ONLY and must NEVER be called outside a Unit Test environment. This method resets a local cache to enable the switching between time zones in a Unit Test environment when calling methods on the Date class.
